update.description:
Workaround for issue #80 by @\_jrivero\_.

When libserverfixture is properly built and installed in Gazebo, we can remove the sources from `test`, but this is an intermediary workaround.

@hsu, I know you a similar workaround in one of your branches, how does this compare?

You will need gazebo installed from default.
update.title: Include ServerFixture

content.raw: Alright, I've added a comment about this issue in da5cf2e. I'll fix `TestUtils.cmake` once the Gazebo issue is resolved.
content.html: Alright, I've added a comment about this issue in da5cf2e. I'll fix TestUtils.cmake once the Gazebo issue is resolved.

update.description:

When libserverfixture is properly built and installed in Gazebo, we can remove the sources from `test`, but this is an intermediary workaround.

@hsu, I know you a similar workaround in one of your branches, how does this compare?

update.title: Include ServerFixture

content.raw:
Yep, a workaround. If we are going with it, please include a comment in the code and create an issue.

It is interesting that linking (hidden) problems are generating a segfault, it is not very common. Maybe related to static variables.
content.html:
Yep, a workaround. If we are going with it, please include a comment in the code and create an issue.

It is interesting that linking (hidden) problems are generating a segfault, it is not very common. Maybe related to static variables.

content.raw: Now, I can run the integration test.
content.html: Now, I can run the integration test.

content.raw:
I think this is related to [gazebo issue 1568](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/1568/gazebo_libraries-out-of-order)

Adding

```
gazebo_sensors
```

before `${GAZEBO_LIBRARIES}` in `TestUtils.cmake` fixes the segfault.
content.html:
I think this is related to gazebo issue 1568

Adding

gazebo_sensors

before ${GAZEBO_LIBRARIES} in TestUtils.cmake fixes the segfault.

content.raw: A problem with this file that I just discovered is that `#include test_config.h` creates a lot of warnings. This is because it's redefining a lot of variables that are initially defined in `gazebo_test_fixture`.

content.raw: By Gazebo convention, unit tests don't go in this path, but then again, this `test_config.h.in` appears to be the same as [the one included in Gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/44947008a7f091693d01e227a955f91ed74908c7/test/test_config.h.in?at=default)... This was something John put when he added the `physics.cc` dummy test, so I'm not sure what the best thing is to do here...
